CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1953, page 3, reads: "First Cancer Fund Check - Mrs. Nellie West of Duff Street is shown as she presents the first check for $100 in the Cancer Fund Drive of 1953 in the Upper Hill District recently. Mrs. Robert E. (Pappy) Williams, neighborhood chairman, working under Mrs. Ella Ruffin, area chairman, is shown receiving the check, while Mrs. Williams' little daughter Rosalyn, pins a 'Cancer Drive' button on Mrs. West. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Two women and a girl, including Nellie West standing on left, holding check for the 1953 Cancer Fund Drive, while Rosalyn Williams pins a button on her dress, and Mrs. Williams watches, gathered around desk with ashtray and telephone in wood paneled office interior
